intro: Paepalanthus chaseae, commonly known as the Chase's puya, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its rosette growth habit and striking, showy inflorescences. The plant produces small, white to yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often in response to seasonal rainfall. It is adapted to high-altitude environments and exhibits succulent leaves to store water. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
